title: N'Golo Kante hands Chelsea boost after Andreas Christensen & Mateo Kovacic suffer injury scares
text:
Christensen appeared to pick up a groin injury playing for Denmark (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea are facing a nervous wait over the fitness of Andreas Christensen, Mateo Kovacic and N’Golo Kante.

The Blues trio have both picked up injuries on international duty and are doubts for Chelsea’s clash with Newcastle.

Kante, who has been struggling with injury for much of the season, was forced to withdraw from France’s game against Iceland last week due a muscle problem.

France coach Didier Deschamps played down concerns about another long-term injury and Kante trained on Sunday.

Kante resumed training on Sunday (Picture: Getty)

However, the defensive midfielder trained away from the main group and is unlikely to play against Turkey.

Chelsea welcome Newcastle to Stamford Bridge on 19 October and could be another midfielder down if Kovacic does not recover after his injury scare.

The 25-year-old hurt himself after a tussle with Ben Davies in Croatia’s draw with Wales on Sunday.

Kovacic needed treatment on the pitch before hobbling off and he did not emerge for the second half.

The Croatian is the second Chelsea player in the space of just a few days to suffer injury on international duty after Christensen limped off playing for Denmark on Saturday.

Kovacic is also a doubt for the Newcastle game (Picture: Reuters)

Like Kovacic, the extent of Christensen’s injury is unknown, but the centre-back was holding his groin when he went off during the 1-0 win over Switzerland.

International breaks often cause issues for clubs, but Frank Lampard will be left cursing his luck should Kante, Kovacic and Christensen miss Chelsea’s next game.

Chelsea are hoping to build on their 4-1 rout of Southampton before the international break and Lampard is already missing several key players.

Ruben Loftus-Cheek, Antonio Rudiger and Emerson Palmieri are all battling injuries.
